body_html:
@vadimkantorov would you expect nn.Parameter.new() to return a nn.Parameter? If so, what would you say the use cases for this are?

If someone calls .new() on a nn.Parameter then immediately assigns it to a module, I'm not sure I would want the module to recognize the new tensor as a "Parameter" of the model. There could be a situation in which the user wants to cache the new tensor.
body_text:
@vadimkantorov would you expect nn.Parameter.new() to return a nn.Parameter? If so, what would you say the use cases for this are?
If someone calls .new() on a nn.Parameter then immediately assigns it to a module, I'm not sure I would want the module to recognize the new tensor as a "Parameter" of the model. There could be a situation in which the user wants to cache the new tensor.
body:
@vadimkantorov would you expect `nn.Parameter.new()` to return a `nn.Parameter`? If so, what would you say the use cases for this are?

If someone calls .new() on a `nn.Parameter` then immediately assigns it to a module, I'm not sure I would want the module to recognize the new tensor as a "Parameter" of the model. There could be a situation in which the user wants to cache the new tensor.
